unnormalised: **Air Quality in Delhi-NCR Plummets Following Diwali Celebrations**
normalised: air quality in Delhi N C R plummets following Diwali celebrations

unnormalised: New Delhi – Air quality across Delhi and the National Capital Region (NCR) has deteriorated significantly in the wake of Diwali festivities. The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) recorded an Air Quality Index (AQI) exceeding 400 in several areas, categorized as "Severe."
normalised: New Delhi – Air quality across Delhi and the National Capital Region N C R has deteriorated significantly in the wake of Diwali festivities. The Central Pollution Control Board C P C B recorded an Air Quality Index A Q I exceeding four hundred in several areas, categorized as "Severe."

unnormalised: Experts attribute the sharp decline to a combination of factors including firecracker emissions, stubble burning in neighboring states like Punjab and Haryana, and meteorological conditions hindering the dispersion of pollutants.
normalised: Experts attribute the sharp decline to a combination of factors including firecracker emissions, stubble burning in neighboring states like Punjab and Haryana, and meteorological conditions hindering the dispersion of pollutants.

unnormalised: "The particulate matter (PM2.5 and PM10) levels have spiked considerably, posing a significant health risk to vulnerable populations, particularly children and the elderly," stated Dr. Sharma, Head of the Environmental Sciences Department at IIT Delhi.
normalised: "The particulate matter P M two point five and P M ten levels have spiked considerably, posing a significant health risk to vulnerable populations, particularly children and the elderly," stated Doctor Sharma, Head of the Environmental Sciences Department at I I T Delhi.

unnormalised: Authorities are urging citizens to minimize outdoor activities and use N95 masks. The Delhi government has announced stricter enforcement of pollution control measures, including increased fines for open burning and illegal construction. The current air quality, resembling a perpetual "smog," has also impacted celebrations of other festivals like Chhath Puja. Many are foregoing preparing their favorite dishes, like spicy biryani, outdoors due to the pollution. The government is working to implement long-term strategies to mitigate air pollution and ensure cleaner air for all residents.
normalised: Authorities are urging citizens to minimize outdoor activities and use N ninety five masks. The Delhi government has announced stricter enforcement of pollution control measures, including increased fines for open burning and illegal construction. The current air quality, resembling a perpetual "smog," has also impacted celebrations of other festivals like Chhath Puja. Many are foregoing preparing their favorite dishes, like spicy biryani, outdoors due to the pollution. The government is working to implement long-term strategies to mitigate air pollution and ensure cleaner air for all residents.
